history.text: Hi there, what's the name of the movie?
Hello!   Have you seen the movie "The Blind Side" before?
I've heard of the name but never watched it. What is it about?
It's a movie about an American football player who was adopted by a family in his community.
Is the football player playing in the NFL?
I'd recommend you see it sometime, Sandra Bullock does a really good job in her role as Leigh Anne Touhy
He's in highschool during the movie, but he goes on to play in the NFL
It's based on a true story, Michael Oher is the football player
Is there a reason why she chooses to adopt him?
what other characters play a role in the movie?
He had a rough upbringing
Tim MCGraw plays the father Sean, he does a good job as well
What do the reviews say about the movie? Is it well received?
It was pretty well received with Rotton Tomatoes giving it 69%  and Metacritic rating 53/100.  CinemaScare gives it an A+
Mostly based on Sandra Bullocks performance, critics really liked her
That is reassuring to hear
when was this movie released?
Back in 2009, though it still seems very current
Do you know what genre this movie belongs to?
It would be considered a sports biographical drama since it is based on Michael Ohres true story.

It's particularly interesting as Sandra Bullock is a memember of a fairly affluent white family, and Michael grew up running away from foster care homes all of his life until he meets the Tuohy family.
where does the movie take place? like what city is it in
It is in Memphis, Tennessee
Ah, so the movie deals with themes of race and wealth inequality?

Yes, very much so.  There is a scene where Sandra Bullock's white wealthy friends ask her if she is concerned about having a large black man in the house with her young daughter.  Sandra becomes quite upset that her friends would think that way.
The movie sounds interesting. I might give it a watch whenever I have free time
Thanks for providing these details
I'd recommend it, one of the better sports movies out there.
Even if you don't like football, it's a good story about the human spirit
and the power of family.
Yes I agree. There must be a lot of character development I'm assuming

uid2response.feedback: The user provided me a lot of details about the movie and allowed me to make an educated decision about whether to watch it or not.
